file_content.text: Poor Mola was devastated to hear that you destroyed the Republic spaceport. I knew you'd leave your mark on Taris.
General Farvin's leading our battle against the best of the Cathar settlers. They've dug in near the wreckage of a crashed Republic cruiser--the Endar Spire.
Help General Farvin against the Cathar. Crush them, and we can finally strike at the Republic's base.
Give me enough time, and I'll make every last sentient on Taris talk. Isn't that right, Mola?
The Jedi's dead, along with his nekghoul colony.
Darth Gravus said you were ruthless.
Sulan's dead. The nekghouls will serve us now.
Darth Gravus will be pleased to hear you saved the Sith's lost creations.
Without their nekghoul pets, the Republic's weak and defenseless.
Darth Gravus must have another assignment for me.
Am I needed elsewhere?
Of course. Taris will always require your talents.
It was my duty.
We always need such loyalty on Taris.
The nekghouls were easy prey.
If it's a challenge you're looking for, I know just the thing.
Kill Master Sulan, defeat his nekghoul flock. Then these sewers will be ours.
Lord Gravus was right about you. The sewers will soon cease to be a threat.
Silence your praise, Melkor. This planet's covered in Sith, all twice as powerful as your friend here.
Step over here. I'll show you just how powerful I am.
Say that to my face.
Swallow your praise, Melkor. This one's an Imperial lackey, come to steal credit for Sith victory.
Step closer. I'll show you how an Imperial punishes insolence.
Say that to my face.
Swallow your gratitude, Melkor. This one's a low-grade merc--not fit for Sith praise.
Praise this.
I'll show you "low-grade."
Don't feed this one's ego, Melkor. I've killed womp rats with better combat skills.
Sith don't bother with the weak. If you have a problem, take it up with me.
Say that to my face.
If you have an issue, take it up with Intelligence.
I don't have time for this.
If you've got something to say, speak to my blaster.
Try insulting me to my face.
Come to bask in my power again?
Oh Thana--my favorite stalker.
I'd as soon bury you as look at you.
Work on those social skills.
I'm here to butcher rakghouls, not make allies.
That's enough! Thana, I trust you've come to do more than spark a fight?
Watch your tone. I'm not on Darth Gravus's leash anymore.
While you poisoned the sewers, I was busy slaughtering rakghouls. One of them hit back without touching me. It was using the Force.
Only Sith deserve to wield the Force. Not abominations.
We must contain their power.
If this is true, they pose a serious threat. Mola... I suggest you start talking.
Tell us what you know about these Force-using creatures.
Ring any bells, Mola?
Sorcery's no match for a good sidearm.
Big deal.
We shouldn't underestimate them. Mola... what do you know about these... things?
If you don't trust me, ask your Republic friend here.
They're called nekghouls. They're sentient... proficient with the Force. A whole colony of them lives in the rundown reactor.
You know the penalty for lying, Mola!
It's true! Master Sulan's with the nekghouls now, teaching them the ways of the light side.
Sulan... I know the name. Idealistic Jedi, powerful but foolish. If he raises these nekghouls against us, we could have trouble.
Sulan will not interfere with the Empire's plans.
Leave the Jedi to me.
Good. Look for him in this reactor Mola mentioned. If he's there, remove him.
I'll massacre the nekghouls.
If Mola's right, the reactor's crawling with nekghouls to slaughter. Go there, and if you find Sulan--kill him.
Maybe I could visit Sulan.
We can't risk ignoring Sulan. Go to the reactor Mola mentioned. See if you can find the Jedi, and kill his stinking nekghouls.
This job requires true mastery of the dark side. Leave it to me.
Don't send a worm to do a Sith's job.
The Jedi will rip you apart. I'll make sure he dies.
First one to overload the reactor core gets to watch the nekghouls fry.
Don't let Thana have all the fun.
I coated the sewers in chemicals. The rakghouls didn't look happy.
Hear that, Mola? The rakghouls will mangle your beloved Republic, and the reactor waste will soak the ground, making your cleanup impossible.
Mola and I will reminisce while you deal with those rakghouls.
Mola, my dear, don't lie. Tell me about the rakghouls.
I'm just a xenozoologist. I've told you everything--ah!
Forgive me, my lord. I get so wrapped up in my interrogations... I lose my head.
Excuse me, sir. Busy breaking another prisoner.
Some people need encouragement to loosen their lips. As I'm sure you know, hunter.
Sorry--didn't see you there. My friend and I were just having a chat.
I'm Melkor Dinn, chief interrogator. Lord Gravus told me you'd come to stop the Republic... and our rakghoul threat.
When it comes to our enemies, I don't discriminate between man and monster.
That's right.
I see why Gravus likes you. Most people become uncomfortable when I mention the rakghouls.
All who oppose the Empire will fall by my hand.
That is correct.
You're the first Imperial I've seen who's eager to go after the rakghouls.
So long as the Empire's footing the bill, I'll kill whatever you want.
Sure, if the pay's good.
We'll gladly compensate anyone willing to go up against the rakghouls.
What are rakghouls?
Rakghouls?
Crazed beasts. They rampage through the sewers, tearing everything apart--us and them.
First tell me what's involved.
We need to destroy the sewers and drive the Republic out. Unfortunately, this is rakghoul territory.
Those vicious mutants swarm the sewers, tearing apart anything--and anyone--that gets in their way.
Serves you right. Sith created the rakghouls to begin with!
Mola's tongue is too free, but she's correct. An ancient Sith engineered the plague to turn humans into rakghouls, then unleashed it on Taris.
The disease survived the planet's destruction. Now rakghouls run rampant, and the Republic's herding them against us.
There must be some way to turn the rakghouls against the Republic.
Drive the creatures back.
That's what we've been working on.
How are they controlling the beasts?
Herding the rakghouls?
Bring 'em on.
Brute strength will help, but we also need devastation on a larger scale.
Mola's been kind enough to tell us about a reactor the Republic's decommissioning.
She claims they direct the rakghouls by releasing trace amounts of toxic waste from the reactor core. This sends the enraged beasts running for safety, right into Imperial territory.
It's true. I saw their aversion to reactor leakage when I studied rakghoul migration patterns. Exposure produced... adverse effects.
How do we drive them off?
So tell me how to stop them.
I wouldn't want to suppose before carrying out the proper tests.
What did these chemicals do?
Adverse how?
Tell me how I wipe those monsters out, or I'll feed you to them.
Get to the point. Now.
Please! There's only one thing I can think of, but it hasn't been tested!
This isn't academic research. Take your best guess, or it will be your last.
During the studies we performed, radiator leakage drove them mad. Poison the rakghouls and they'll turn on everyone--you, us, each other.
Perfect. We blow up the chemical stashes, poison the lot. The rakghouls will be too busy feasting on Republic flesh to run our way.
It's time the Republic faces Taris's monsters.
I'll rile the rakghouls.
If the chemicals don't enrage the rakghouls, I'm coming back for you.
You better not be lying, Mola.
I never lie about my work.
That may be, but I'm not done with you yet.
These charges should blow the chemical casks nicely. Set them off, and stir those rakghouls into a frenzy!
Sounds unsafe. [Refuse quest]
Lord Gravus thought you'd be more willing. I'm sorry he was wrong.
Excuse me. My subjects don't interrogate themselves.
The Force? Impossible.
The Force? Yeah, right.
